page.title: 15PEEL HALL, INCE
page.content: { Peel Hall}is a manor house built by the Earl of Makerfield in{1345}and is situated near Rose Bridge. The house is being renovated by the family of one of our{pupils}who says, "I like living in Peel Hall because of its age and style. It has more space and bigger rooms, which makes living there different. It's peaceful and quiet; there's a large garden for pets and farm animals." His{mother}commented, "Sometimes in this house you feel as if time has stood still; but with gas heating, a washer and a freezer, life is much easier than it was in the past. However, it is draughty in winter." His{father}described the half complete renovation, "We bought the house in 1982. To make it water tight the English oak timber frame needed treatment; all the mediaeval wattle and daub had to be removed."
